author: @Nhan Dan Online
title: Victory of Great Patriotic War marked in Hanoi | Nhan Dan Online
text: The annual event aims to pay tribute to the heroes who sacrificed for the peace and freedom of their country as well educate the patriotism and national pride among younger generations. Speaking at the ceremony, Russian Ambassador to Vietnam Gennady Bezdetko stressed the significance of the Great Patriotic War of the former Soviet people. | | The delegates conclude the parade. He also affirmed that the Great Patriotic War in 1945 fundamentally changed the world map, opened a new page of history, and marked the collapse of the world colonial system. The Ambassador also expressed his gratitude to Vietnamese volunteers who fought alongside with the former Soviet Union army to defend Moscow, contributing to he great victory of the Soviet people. | | The delegates pay tribute to the heroes who sacrificed for the peace and happiness of humanity. Belarusian Ambassador to Vietnam Uladzimir Baravikou affirmed that the Belarusian people always respect the memories of the Victory of the Great Patriotic War. He noted that valuing and appreciating the glorious victories of the former Soviet state and people is the sacred duty and obligation of every Belarusian, thereby affirming the spirit of solidarity and fight to protect peace, freedom and independence of the country. | | The delegates plant trees to commemorate the Great Patriotic War. Major General Trinh Quoc Khanh, Permanent Vice Chairman of the Vietnam-Russia Friendship Association, emphasised the traditional relationship between Vietnam and the former Soviet Union and between Vietnam and Russia today. He said that during the Great Patriotic War, Vietnamese volunteer soldiers stood side by side with the people of the former Soviet Union to fight to protect the capital city of Moscow. Meanwhile, During Vietnamâ€™s resistance war against America, many Soviet experts helped the Vietnamese people. | | An art performance at the ceremony. On the occasion, the delegates enjoyed a special art programme and planted trees at the Vietnam Youth Academy.

author: Fernando Palacios
title: Â¿QuÃ© pasa en el Metro CDMX hoy 29 de diciembre? Reportan retrasos en LÃ­nea 7; pese al frÃ­o mantienen ventiladores encendidos en los trenes
text: El [Metro de la Ciudad de MÃ©xico (CDMX)](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estados/cdmx/que-pasa-en-el-metro-cdmx-hoy-28-de-diciembre-retiran-a-persona-de-las-vias-en-linea-2-pese-al-frio-denuncian-ventiladores-encendidos/) ve afectadas sus operaciones hoy 29 de diciembre, pues distintos usuarios de la LÃ­nea 7 (El Rosario a Barranca del Muerto) reportan retrasos esta maÃ±ana. Las redes sociales del Metro CDMX indicaron 5 minutos de espera para el paso de una unidad en la LÃ­nea 7 a las 6:30 de la maÃ±ana, pero esta informaciÃ³n fue rechazada por los pasajeros: â€œQuÃ© onda con la LÃ­nea 7 estÃ¡ tardando demasiado y no hay gente ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡â€Usuario del Metro CDMX Otro usuario reportÃ³ la misma situaciÃ³n en la estaciÃ³n San JoaquÃ­n de la LÃ­nea 7: [Metro CDMX: Anuncian obras en tramo San LÃ¡zaro a OceanÃ­a de LÃ­nea B](/estados/cdmx/metro-cdmx-anuncian-obras-en-tramo-san-lazaro-a-oceania-de-linea-b/) [Metro CDMX estÃ¡ preocupado por Navi; hasta radiografÃ­a sacÃ³ del perrito](/estados/cdmx/metro-cdmx-esta-preocupado-por-navi-hasta-radiografia-saco-del-perrito/) [SalomÃ³n Chertorivski se subiÃ³ al Metro de CDMX y, casual, un reportero se lo encontrÃ³](/estados/cdmx/salomon-chertorivski-se-subio-al-metro-de-cdmx-y-casual-un-reportero-se-lo-encontro/) [Alternativas a LÃ­nea 9 del Metro: Paso a paso de cÃ³mo llegar a conciertos en Foro Sol y Palacio de los Deportes](/estados/cdmx/alternativas-a-linea-9-del-metro-paso-a-paso-de-como-llegar-a-conciertos-en-foro-sol-y-palacio-de-los-deportes/) â€œÂ¡MÃ¡s de 10 minutos esperando que pase un tren en San JoaquÃ­n! Y los vagones a mÃ¡xima capacidadâ€Usuario del Metro CDMX Las redes sociales del Sistema de transporte Colectivo (STC) solo respondieron en el primer caso, pero se negÃ³ que existiera un problema en la circulaciÃ³n de los trenes de la LÃ­nea 7: â€œBuen dÃ­a. La LÃ­nea 7 no presenta averÃ­as, se agiliza la circulaciÃ³n de los trenes. Permite el libre cierre, asÃ­ como descender del vagÃ³n antes de ingresar. Al momento el avance es continuoâ€Metro CDMX Usuarios del Metro CDMX reportan ventiladores encendidos, pese al clima de frÃ­o Por otro lado, distintos usuarios del Metro CDMX manifestaron descontento debido a que las unidades del STC mantienen los ventiladores encendidos, a pesar del clima de frÃ­o que prevalece en el paÃ­s. â€œApaguen los ventiladores vagÃ³n m.0162 de Rosario a Barranca del Muerto, va llegando a Auditorio, graciasâ€Usuario del Metro CDMX El caso anterior se repitiÃ³ en la LÃ­nea 8 (Garibaldi a ConstituciÃ³n de 1917), de acuerdo con el reporte de una usuaria: â€œÂ¿Pueden apagar el aire del vagÃ³n N1768, LÃ­nea 8 por favor?â€Usuaria del Metro CDMX Y otro situaciÃ³n igual se reportÃ³ en la LÃ­nea A (PantitlÃ¡n a La Paz) a las 7:20 de la maÃ±ana: Â¿Pueden apagar el aire del metro FM020 de lÃ­nea La Paz?Usuario del Metro CDMX En los tres casos, las redes sociales del Metro CDMX respondieron: â€œBuen dÃ­a. Se canaliza la informaciÃ³n con el Ã¡rea operativa para verificar la situaciÃ³n. Agradecemos el reporteâ€Metro CDMX Metro CDMX: Seis estaciones de la LÃ­nea B cerrarÃ¡n por renivelaciÃ³n en las vÃ­as La LÃ­nea B del Metro CDMX se sumarÃ¡ a los trabajos de mantenimiento que iniciaron en la LÃ­nea 1 en julio de 2022, asÃ­ como las a las labores de renivelaciÃ³n que actualmente se lleva a cabo en la LÃ­nea 9. Las estaciones de la LÃ­nea B que serÃ¡n cerradas son: - Morelos - San LÃ¡zaro - Flores MagÃ³n - Romero Rubio - OceanÃ­a - Deportivo OceanÃ­a De acuerdo con la licitaciÃ³n hecha pÃºblica, las obras en la LÃ­nea B tendrÃ­an que iniciar el 18 de enero de 2024, a fin de que los trabajos de mantenimiento finalicen el 18 de junio del mismo aÃ±o. En ese sentido, se contempla un servicio provisional de la Red de Transporte de Pasajeros (RTP). El costo para abordar una unidad es de 5 pesos y el transbordo es gratuito con una tarjeta de Movilidad Integrada.

author: New York Times
title: Israeli-American Thought to Be a Hostage Was Killed on Oct. 7, Her Family Says
text:
Judih Weinstein Haggai, a 70-year-old who was believed to have been taken hostage by Hamas, was actually killed during the Oct. 7 attacks on Israel, her family and Kibbutz Nir Oz said in statements on Thursday.
Ms. Haggaiâ€™s husband, Gadi Haggai, had also been listed as a hostage but the Hostages and Missing Persons Families Forum announced last week that he, too, was killed in the attacks.
The forum said the couple were shot while on their morning walk through the fields of the kibbutz, and that Ms. Haggai had managed to inform friends that they had been injured, her husband critically so.
Ms. Haggai was, in fact, fatally wounded, and her death has now been confirmed, Kibbutz Nir Oz said on Thursday. Its statement did not specify how it learned that she had died in the attack.
The coupleâ€™s bodies are being held by Hamas, according to the kibbutz, their family and the Hostages and Missing Persons Families Forum. The groups said the couple were citizens of both Israel and the United States, and that Ms. Haggai also had Canadian citizenship.
President Biden said he and Jill Biden, the first lady, were holding the coupleâ€™s â€œfour children, seven grandchildren and other loved ones close to our hearts.â€
â€œI will never forget what their daughter, and the family members of other Americans held hostage in Gaza, have shared with me,â€ he said in a statement . â€œThey have been living through hell for weeks.â€
Ms. Haggai would be remembered â€œfor the creative life she built with her husband,â€ her family said, adding that â€œtheir murders are a reminder for leaders everywhere to bring the hostages home now before it is too late.â€
The post Israeli-American Thought to Be a Hostage Was Killed on Oct. 7, Her Family Says appeared first on New York Times .

organizations.name: hostages and missing persons families forum

author: Shannon Brown
title: Met Office predicts New Year's Day washout - Devon Live
text: However you intend to celebrate the start of 2024, the Met Office is predicting a miserable and rainy wash out weekend in Devon. There is little respite from Storm Gerrit, as meteorologists say more unsettled [weather](https://www.devonlive.com/all-about/weather) is on its way, with a band of heavy rain is expected to move in from the south west. The Exeter-based forecaster has said rainfall in the UK has been above average during 2023, brought about by a wetter-than-usual autumn and it seems as though the start of 2024 will be more of the same. Scattered, heavy showers are set to sweep across Devon on December 31, with a heavy deluge arriving in Devon from 9am on January 1. While strong winds are still expected over the new year weekend, the Met Office says these won't be nearly as strong as those brought by Storm Gerrit, which is still playing havoc with the British weather. In the West Country, trees were brought down and some road bridges were closed, while a reported 'tornado' damaged around 100 homes in Greater Manchester amid 160mph winds. The heaviest rain will start to move in from Cornwall by around 12pm on January 1 and, according to Met Office weather maps, is unlikely to let up until the following day. While still breezy, wind speeds will be lower than seen recently, and are likely to drop further on January 1. Steven Ramsdale is a Met Office Chief Forecaster. He said: â€œThis system is likely to bring a range of weather including hill snow. Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.â€ Temperatures across Devon are unlikely to reach more than 8-9C, and it will feel colder than is has during this [Christmas](https://www.devonlive.com/all-about/christmas) Week. The Met Office says there is low confidence in the forecast heading into 2024. Nick Silkstone, Met Office Deputy Chief Forecaster, said: â€œThrough to mid-January, there is a signal for a shift in the pattern compared to the winter so far, with more settled and colder-than-average conditions becoming increasingly likely.â€ Met Office South West forecast Today Another day of blustery showers, heavy at times, with some sunny spells. Staying rather mild and remaining breezy, especially in any heavy downpours though less windy than recent days. Maximum temperature 11 Â°C. Tonight Any day time showers gradually easing through the evening allowing for clearer skies for a time and lighter winds. Turning cloudier by dawn with some patchy rain from the west. Minimum temperature 4 Â°C. Saturday Turning unsettled with cloud and outbreaks of rain pushing in from the west. Rain turning heavy at times, especially later over the hills with strong gusty winds and coastal gales. Maximum temperature 12 Â°C. Outlook for Sunday to Tuesday Often cloudy on Sunday with some blustery showers in the west. Largely fine on New Year's Day with a few showers. Cloudier on Tuesday with rain and stronger winds.

author: @politico
title: â€˜A tired old political stump tacticâ€™: Republicans of color dismayed by Haley - POLITICO
text: Among other points of frustration is the sense that the GOP candidates still canâ€™t seem to talk about the horrors of slavery. Republicans of color said on Thursday they were dismayed by Nikki Haleyâ€™s initial refusal to say that slavery was the cause of the Civil War. It wasnâ€™t just an offensive historical omission, they argued, but a tactical blunder too. â€œShe easily couldâ€™ve communicated better in that moment, but chose to use a tired old political stump tactic by tossing the same question back to the guy who asked,â€ said Rina Shah, a Republican strategist based in Washington, D.C., in a text to POLITICO. â€œWhat I do see is her having left out the word â€˜slaveryâ€™ because she was scared to talk about anything regarding our nationâ€™s complicated history. I think by acknowledging slavery she felt she might be alienatingâ€ Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis voters. Haley, who is currently running in second among GOP primary voters in both New Hampshire and South Carolina, according to the Real Clear Politics polling average , declined on Wednesday night to say slavery was the cause of Americaâ€™s deadliest war. The next morning, she attempted to clarify her statement during an interview with The Pulse of NH . â€œI mean of course, the Civil War was about slavery,â€ said the former South Carolina governor. â€œWe know that, thatâ€™s the easy part.â€ She also claimed that the questioner during the town hall was a â€œDemocratic plant.â€ Black Republicans like Shermichael Singleton, who has worked on previous Republican presidential campaigns including Mitt Romney and Ben Carson, remained disenchanted. Singleton said he believed Haley was right that her questioner was a plant. But he didnâ€™t think that was an excuse for fumbling the answer. â€œShe shouldâ€™ve been able to answer the damn question and move on,â€ he said. He added that her comments likely alienated moderate Republicans and swing voters she desperately needed to mount a successful challenge for the nomination. â€œShe had a chance to be competitive even though she was always likely to lose [the nomination]. However, thatâ€™s over now. Sheâ€™s toast,â€ Singleton said. Not all Republicans of color who spoke to POLITICO thought the moment would trip up Haleyâ€™s campaign. Though arguing that she could have been more nuanced in her answer, conservative talk show host Armstrong Williams called the episode a teachable moment. â€œThere were so many other issues that caused the Civil War, whether it be statesâ€™ rights, the role of our federal government at the time, â€¦ the economy [Americans at that time] felt was in shambles,â€ Williams said. â€œBut what she has to realize is all these issues, no matter what they were, were inextricably bound to the institution of slavery. She cannot separate slavery from any of these issues no matter how many she mentions.â€ But, Williams added, he didnâ€™t think the episode would torpedo her campaign. â€œNo, nor should it,â€ Williams said. â€œListen, Nikki Haley is not a racist. Sheâ€™s not a bigot. Sheâ€™s a politician,â€ he said. â€œAnd sometimes politicians do what politicians do and they pay the price for it. And sheâ€™s paid the price for not being the person of courage and having the moral clarity to speak the truth.â€ For Republicans of color, the Haley maelstrom was frustrating in part because sheâ€™s not the first GOP candidate who has been tripped up by the issue of slavery. In August, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis found himself in the crosshairs of fellow Republicans of color after his state issued revised guidelines requiring teachers to instruct some school-age children that â€œslaves developed skills which, in some instances, could be applied for their personal benefit.â€ Among others, Rep. Byron Donalds (R-Fla.), took issue with the instructions, saying the personal benefit characterization was â€œwrong and needs to be adjusted.â€ The DeSantis camp dug in, saying Donalds, who is Black, was parroting talking points of Vice President Kamala Harris. It led to a slew of Black Republicans coming to Donaldsâ€™ defense and openly questioning the viability of the DeSantis campaign. DeSantisâ€™ campaign was one of several that piled on Haley after her remarks, with the Florida governor calling her response â€œincomprehensible word salad.â€ Still, it is unclear how big an impact it will have with voters in the early voting states of Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina. Some Republicans said a stumble like this, with just 18 days before the Iowa Caucus, is something Haley could ill afford. â€œWhy Nikki Haley felt the need to sidestep a question that shouldâ€™ve been a lay up is beyond me,â€ said Gen Z GOP activist CJ Pearson. He pointed to a common pushback by conservatives: that southern Democrats were defenders of the institution of slavery before splintering off from their party brethren. â€œWe are the party of Lincoln, the party of abolition. We should stand on that, unapologetically and unequivocally,â€ said Pearson. And as for blunting her momentum, he added that the Haley camp had cause to be concerned. â€œI will say that a lot of independent voters who have rallied behind her probably woke up with a lot more pause this morning about her candidacy than they went to sleep with.â€

author: Loren Valbuena
title: Los cinco cÃ³cteles que serÃ¡n tendencia para celebrar el AÃ±o Nuevo en Colombia
text:
Faltan pocos dÃ­as para que se acabe el 2024 y son varias las personas a las que les gusta despedir el aÃ±o con unas buenas bebidas. SegÃºn cifras de Fenalco, el consumo de las bebidas alcohÃ³licas el 31 de diciembre se incrementa hasta un 30 % frente a otros meses del aÃ±o, sin contar el aumento en ventas de hasta un 20 % que registran los establecimientos de comercio en esta noche de rumba.
Cabe mencionar que la demanda de cÃ³cteles viene en aumento y estos se estÃ¡n posicionando como la bebida preferida de las personas. Muchos se estÃ¡n yendo por opciones como el mojito, el gin tonic o la margarita, por encima de otros tragos tradicionales como una cerveza o un shot de aguardiente o ron.
Teniendo en cuenta esto, el Grupo La Movida, dueÃ±o del club nocturno La Movida en Cartagena, realizÃ³ un informe de cierre de aÃ±o que revela cuÃ¡les son los cinco cocteles que serÃ¡n tendencia para celebrar el AÃ±o Nuevo en Colombia.
TambiÃ©n: La destilerÃ­a Laizhou: LÃ­der en la producciÃ³n de whisky y baijiu en Sichuan, China
Los cÃ³cteles en tendencia
Carlos Sierra, director creativo de Barra 7, otro de los bares operados por el Grupo La Movida y especialista en coctelerÃ­a, destacÃ³ los cinco cocteles temÃ¡ticos que serÃ¡n tendencia en San Silvestre.
1. Zuly: Se prepara a base de mezcal, coco, extracto de piÃ±a, zumo de limÃ³n, bitter (hierbas, flores, especias, frutas o raÃ­ces maceradas en alcohol que luego son infusionadas) y picante.
2. Mangroove: Tiene un sabor frutal y picante, que combina el tradicional Margarita con el mango viche, la sal y el limÃ³n, sumando un toque especial de buen tequila, licor de naranja y tajÃ­n.
3. Rola Plum: Se sirve en una copa coupÃ© adornada con una espuma con aroma a cereza. Se hace con ciruela roja, mejor conocida en la costa como ciruela rola, vodka y polvo de flor de Jamaica.
4. Mezcal Paloma: Con su sabor cÃ­trico y ahumado, este aÃ±o fue tendencia mundial. Cuenta con una mezcla de tequila, mezcal, licor de toronja, miel de agave, soda y sal de togarashi (combinaciÃ³n de chile, piel de mandarina, semillas de amapola, pimienta, ajonjolÃ­, jengibre y nori o algas comestibles).
5. Moscow Mule: Es picante y a la vez refrescante. Se prepara con vodka, jengibre, zumo de limÃ³n y soda.
Recomendado: Este es el licor que prefieren consumir los colombianos para celebrar Navidad y aÃ±o nuevo
El informe de fin de aÃ±o de Grupo La Movida ademÃ¡s indica que las tendencias en coctelerÃ­a para 2025 serÃ¡n: cÃ³cteles sostenibles, consumo consciente, uso de ingredientes saludables y bebidas listas para tomar que ya estÃ¡n preparadas y envasadas, a las que solo se necesita ponerles hielo.
